title: USL wants to keep Harrisburg as home of Islanders
text:
USL wants to keep Harrisburg as home of Islanders 
Updated: 
Posted by: Jason Bristol 
HARRISBURG -- Despite the on-going stadium issues for the City Islanders, the United Soccer League's president says the league "absolutely" wants to keep the franchise in Harrisburg. 
USL President Jake Edwards made his comments to CBS 21 News Sports Director Jason Bristol during a media conference call on Thursday. 
But the team has to find a new home. 
Skyline Sports Complex is not a suitable environment for players or fans, Edwards says. 
The club is still seeking funds for a $14 million renovation project . The plans include upgrading the facility to more than 4,500 seats; creating a new entrance plaza, new concession area, locker rooms, and restroom facilities; installing a new scoreboard and a variety of other amenities designed to allow this facility to be a multi-use soccer field, youth development center and concert arena, according to a news release. 
The club could also find a new site for a stadium, as well. 
Read More at: http://www.local21news.com/sports/features/sports-unlimited/stories/Source-No-City-money-used-for-City-Islanders-new-stadium-140348.shtml 
The 2015 USL Championship game is Friday, featuring the Rochester Rhinos and the LA Galaxy II. Harrisburg failed to make the playoffs.
